quizzes.title: History Quiz: World War and California
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, troops, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Was the Soviet Union part of the Axis Powers during World War II?
In 1962 President Kennedy of the US and Chairman Khrushchev of the Soviet Union were able to peacefully end a confrontation which might have led to a nuclear war. Where was this crisis centered?
Children, and many adults too, were happy when the first Disneyland opened in California in this year.
What day in 1944 is referred to as D-Day?
In the 1960s, Humans finally achieved an age-old dream of landing on the Moon. Who was the first person to set foot on the Moon and in what year did this happen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neil Armstrong, 1969

questions.question: When did the Allies capture Tobruk during World War II?
Early in his administration this US President survived being shot by an assassin and even showed a sense of humor when he told his wife, Honey, I forgot to duck.
Where did the D-Day invasion occur?
Did Warsaw surrender to German troops in 1940?
During WWII, upon leaving the Philippines, American general Douglass Mcarthur said I will never return.
What nickname did Erwin Rommel get during World War II?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Desert Fox

questions.question: In 1954 Roger Bannister became the first person in history to do which of the following?

options.text: win Noble Prizes in three different categories
run a mile in under four minutes

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: run a mile in under four minutes

questions.question: During World War II, Japan was one of the Axis powers.
The Zodiak killer is a suspect in the murders of Lindsay Cutshall and Jason S. Allen who were murdered in their sleeping bags on Fish Head Beach in Jenner, California in August 2004?
In what month in 1945 did Japan surrender to the US?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Space and Person
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, john, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On October 24, 1960, over 100 people died in the Soviet Union, in a rocket explosion that was not reported until the 1990s.
Name the first state to secede from the Union.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Carolina

questions.question: Who was the first person in space?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yuri Gagarin

questions.question: This year was fatal for Russian space exploration, because after a normal re-entry of the capsule of the Soyuz 11 mission, the ground team opened the capsule to find the crew dead.
On February 1, 2003, during the Space Shuttle Columbia disaster, the entire seven-member crew died. However, something on the shuttle survived the crash. What was it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Some worms

questions.question: Which of these statements about the state of the human body during space flights has been proven?

options.text: Astronauts tend to have memory problems during longer flights.
Astronauts tend to have elevated testosterone levels in space.
Astronauts tend to have a reduced amount of testosterone in space.
Astronauts tend to have a decreased capacity for exercise and brain activity when in outer space.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Astronauts tend to have a reduced amount of testosterone in space.

questions.question: The first person who lost his life in a space flight was the Soviet cosmonaut, Vladimir M. Komarov. How did he die?

options.text: The capsule of his Soyuz 1 spacecraft burned upon re-entry, due to damage to the heat shields.
His Soyuz 1 capsule landed on hard ground rather than making a soft, water landing.
His Soyuz 1 capsule burnt up in space because the heat shields were inadequate.
The parachutes on his Soyuz 1 capsule did not deploy and the hard entry caused his death.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The parachutes on his Soyuz 1 capsule did not deploy and the hard entry caused his death.

questions.question: Soviet cosmonaut Yuri Gagarin, who in 1961 became the first human to enter outer space, died in 1968. What was the cause of his death?

options.text: He developed AIDS and was not treated.
He was killed in an car accident.
He was killed in a plane crash.
A plane he was piloting was shot down by Chechen rebels.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was killed in a plane crash.

questions.question: In what month of 1941 did Nazi Germanys invasion of the Soviet Union start?
American astronaut John Glenn piloted the first American manned orbital mission, aboard Friendship 7 on February 20, 1962.  What actor performed a song, dedicated to him?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walter Brennan

questions.question: This Russian cosmonaut was likely to have been the third or fourth person in space, but was dismissed from the cosmonaut corps in 1963, because of drunkenness and disorderly behavior at Chkalovskiy station.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grigori Nelyubov

questions.question: When did the Germans invade Yugoslavia and Greece during World War II?
What astronaut almost drowned in 1961, when his Liberty Bell 7 capsule sank upon splashdown in the Pacific Ocean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gus Grissom

questions.question: On September 23, 1999, the Mars Climate Orbiter, whose mission was to study the Martian weather, climate, and water, crashed on the Martian surface, instead of starting to orbit around the planet. What was the reason for this accident?

options.text: The atmospheric stresses and friction were greater than expected.
A mechanical fault in the protective shield
Confusion in the system of units in the navigation of the spacecraft
Mars gravitation forces were greater than expected.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Confusion in the system of units in the navigation of the spacecraft

questions.question: The grave of Jesse James was exhumed in 1995 and it was found out that the person buried there was actually Jesse James.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Battle and Island
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, kamikaze, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The kamikaze, Japanese suicide planes that crashed into Allied ships, first made a systematic appearance in 1944 during the fighting near this location.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Philippines

questions.question: How long did Hitlers Third Reich last?
In what sea were the combined naval forces of the US, Britain, Netherlands and Australia decisively defeated by the Japanese Navy as they advanced in Southeast Asia in 1942?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Java Sea

questions.question: This Japanese city had a large section burned out in a fire storm started by a large B29 air raid in March 1945. Although statistics are inadequate to judge conclusively, the raid may have killed as many people in one night as were killed by the atomic bomb at Hiroshima.
The battle that is generally considered the turning point of the Pacific War was fought on and near this island.
Where did the Japanese and Americans fight for about six months in 1942 before the Japanese were finally defeated and their advance in the Solomon Islands stopped?

In 1944 the US Navy air arm effectively destroyed the Japanese naval air power by sinking three Japanese aircraft carriers and shooting down about 600 Japanese planes in a battle the Americans nicknamed the turkey shoot. In what sea, which gives the battle its name, did this happen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Philippine Sea

questions.question: The Doolittle raid was the first time the US bombed Japan in the Pacific War. The bombers were launched from an aircraft carrier but the Japanese did not know where the bombers came from. What place did President Roosevelt facetiously name as the place where the bombers had come from?

options.text: an underground air base in China

questions.question: Who is the first president of the U. S. in the 21st century?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Clinton

questions.question: What was the only major city in the Pacific theater of operations in which there was major urban warfare between US and Japanese forces?

This island, captured by US forces in 1944, was close enough for B29 bombers to fly round trip to Japan. A major air base was built there from which many B29 bombing attacks were launched and the planes carrying the atomic bombs took off.
In what body of water was a naval battle fought in 1942 in which, for the first time in history, the ships of both sides never saw each other?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coral Sea

questions.question: The British and their allies were shocked in 1942 when the Japanese captured a British colonial city that was supposed to be so well fortified as to be immune to attack. What was that city?
During World War Two, General MacArthurs US forces, with help from Australian forces, methodically and skillfully drove the Japanese from the second largest island in the world. What is that island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Guinea

questions.question: The last major battle of World War Two was also the one that caused the most casualties to the US and their allies (mostly British) in the Pacific War. Where was this battle fought?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Wwii and War
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, leader, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: During WWII, the SS formed a unit called the Werewolves to resist allied occupation forces.
What was the name of the airplane that dropped the a-bomb over Nagasaki  on August 9, 1945?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bocks Car

questions.question: Adolf Hitlers father, Alois, changed his last name to Hitler. What was his original last name?
During the Nuremberg trails, 30% of the defendants claimed the Holocaust never occurred, the remainder claimed they were just following orders.
Who led the Vichy regime in France during WWII?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marshall Petain

questions.question: Who was Geli Raubel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One of Hitlers nieces

questions.question: Which of these countries was not neutral during WWII?
During WWII Joseph Stalin was leader of the Soviet Union. His name, Stalin, means Man of Power.
The Soviet Union declared war on Japan on August 1, 1945.
This American explorer, a former member of the US Senate, rediscovered the Inca settlement of Machu Picchu.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hiram Bingham

questions.question: This Spanish conquistador, the founder of the City of Lima, conquered the Inca Empire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Francisco Pizarro

questions.question: What was the language of the Inca Empire, used by the Catholic Church to preach to Indians in the Andes area?
The title of Hitlers book Mein Kampf means My Story.
What is the name of the last Inca Emperor, who defeated his older half-brother in a civil war and took the throne?
What was the code name for the invasion of Japan during WWII, which was never undertaken due to the end of the war?

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Battle and Ruler
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, officials, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of the following city states was not on the territory of present-day Greece?
Agamemnon, one of the most notable heroes of Greek mythology, was a ruler of Mycenae.
How many provincial regions did the Inca Empire have?
Alexander the Great commanded the Macedonian army and defeated Athens, Thebes and their allies at the Battle of Chaeronea (338 BC).
What was the scene of the last major battle of the Peloponnesian War?
In early 6th century BC, the city states of Akragas, Gela, and Syracuse sent ships to the city of Himera in west Sicily, where they defeated an invading force coming from where?
What did the Inca officials wear in order to indicate their status?
This title, which in English means the only one,  was used by the ruler of the Inca Empire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sapa Inca

questions.question: The Battle of Cajamarca, in which the last Inca emperor was captured, took place in which year?
A story says that a Spartan wife gave this advice to her husband, upon his departure for the battlefield.

options.text: May Zeus strengthen you and return you home safely.
May the blood of your enemies be as red as your cloak.
Come home with your shield or upon it.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Come home with your shield or upon it.

questions.question: What was the result of the Athenian invasion of Syracuse during the Peloponnesian War?

options.text: Syracuse was destroyed and Sparta later surrendered.
The Romans defeated both sides and took over Sicily.
Carthage invaded and controlled western Sicily.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Athenians were defeated.

questions.question: This kingdom, the largest in the Late Intermediate period of the cultural history of Peru, was eventually conquered by the Inca Empire in 1493.
Who was the god of mountains in the Inca mythology?
Ancient Greece was the birthplace of the chariot.
This town, after which an Olympic event was named, was the site of a battle where the Athenian army defeated the Persians in 490 BC.

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Cleopatra and Calendar
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, egypt, cleopatras. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The word Calendar comes form Latin kalendae. What does this word mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First days of each month

questions.question: Cleopatras son by Julius Caesar, who reigned, as a child, jointly with his mother, was nicknamed Caesarion. What does Caesarion mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Little Caesar

questions.question: Who wrote the tragedy Antony and Cleopatra, which centers on Cleopatra and Mark Antonys relationship from the time of the Parthian War until Cleopatras suicide?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Shakespeare

questions.question: To what dynasty did Cleopatra, the last Pharaoh of Ancient Egypt, belong?
During Cleopatras reign it was believed that she was the re-incarnation and embodiment of this goddess of wisdom.
Why is the 9th month of the Gregorian calendar called September?

options.text: After Septimus Severus - a Roman Emperor
September was the 7th month in Roman calendar

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: September was the 7th month in Roman calendar

questions.question: Cleopatra formed an alliance with Mark Anthony, one of the triumvirs who ruled Rome following Caesars death. How many children did Mark Anthony and Cleopatra have?
The Gregorian Calendar was introduced in 1582. Which one of these countries was among the first to adopt it?
How did Cleopatra commit suicide according to ancient sources?

options.text: by stabbing herself with a sword
by stabbing herself with a poisoned arrow
by inducing an asp to bite her

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: by inducing an asp to bite her

questions.question: The internationally accepted civil calendar is called Gregorian. After who was it named?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pope Gregory XIII

questions.question: How did Cleopatra present herself to Julius Caesar when he seized the Egyptian capital in 48 BC ?

options.text: with a snake around her neck

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: rolled into a Persian carpet

questions.question: How many months in the Gregorian calendar have 31 days?
After Cleopatra and Anthonys death, who became guardian of their children?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Octavia Minor, Anthonys fourth wife

questions.question: What future emperor of the Roman Empire had Cleopatra and Julius Caesars son, Caesarion, executed?
Who defeated Mark Antony and Cleopatra at the Battle of Actium, the last engagement in the Final War of the Roman Republic?
